comments:
PLATFORM: Linux x86
VERSION: 2.1.2 GTK
PROBLEM: Every few months, I am forced to restore my eclipse directory from
backup. This is because cvs completely stops working. All existing repositories
are lost. I can not re-add the repositories. The only way to recover is to
restore my eclipse directory from the previous day's backup.

OTHER INFORMATION: This seems to happen most when I am doing heavy development
for long periods of time. Another contributor might be my work habit of running
eclipse not only from the main console (DISPLAY localhost:0) but also frequently
by launching a vnc session and running eclips within that vnc session. I also
frequently ssh into my workstation and export the display to a remote machine
and run eclipse from there.

LOG FILE URL: http://www.okmoore.com/eclipse.log 
LOG FILE NOTES: I replaced some phrases with an alternate phrase to maintian
some privacy of data in the log.

It looks like this all started with an out-of-memory exception. I suspect this 
corrupted the workspace which surfacd the CVS problems.

The following errors were logged but unfortunately do not contain enough 
information. We should make sure we should log everything we can. I've added a 
descritpion about what we should do for each problem

1) Could not load state. Probably due to missing connection method (i.e. 
plugin.xml does not seem to be loaded)

ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 4 Feb 08, 2004 10:03:57.815
!MESSAGE Error loading state
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSException: Invalid CVS repository 
location format: :extssh:myuseraccount@svr001:/path/to/cvsroot

2) Could not instantiate provider (again, probably due to missing extension 
definitions)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 Feb 08, 2004 10:05:45.731
!MESSAGE Could not instantiate provider org.eclipse.team.cvs.core.cvsnature 
for project slee_calendar.

3) Missing an NLS string in a bundel somewhere.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 0 Feb 08, 2004 10:06:42.205
!MESSAGE CVSProviderPlugin.execProblem

4) Core error (will forward to Platform Core)

!MESSAGE Could not close indexed 
store: /path/to/my/eclipse/workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resour
ces/.root/.properties.

COMMENT: The idea that this originates with an Out of Memory error sound very
reasonable in my mind. There are (rare) occasions when memory usage will spiral
skyward into hundreds of MB's towards an eventual crash. There have been times
when this has reached 900MB+ (according to top). The event that perscipitates
these rare occurrances happen during the action of either closing or opening a
source file. I can't remember which tho. Also, the inability to use CVS is
preceeded by one or more crashed of the IDE.

QUESTION: Is there something you would like for me to turn on within my
environment that would give more detailed logging? Something to help debug this
the next time it happens?

I've talked to the Platform Core team and they say that the result of the Core 
error would be a loss of all persistant properties (which would be consitant 
with the loss of all repositories and team sharing). However, the workspace 
should still be usable. The next time it happens, keep a copy of the workspace 
sp we can determine the extent of the damage. You should be able to reshare 
the projects in your workspace using Team>Share which should, in turn, 
recreate the repository locations. Did you try this before?
This bug has goen stale. Please reopen if you are still experiencing problems.
